title: ICE in wfcheck.rs, check_impl_item when building librustc with incremental compilation

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
For the second time, I am now seeing an ICE when building librustc with `incremental = true` (unfortunately the stack trace is a bit messed up by cargo's progress bar, Cc https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/6119):
Show backtrace ``` Building stage1 compiler artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu) Compiling rustc v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/src/librustc) Compiling rustc-demangle v0.1.9 Compiling fmt_macros v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/src/libfmt_macros) Compiling rustc_fs_util v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/src/librustc_fs_util) Compiling rustc-serialize v0.3.24 Compiling quick-error v1.2.2 Compiling rustc_platform_intrinsics v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/src/librustc_platform_intrinsics) Compiling crossbeam-utils v0.2.2 thread 'main' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', libcore/option.rs:355:21rustc-demangle, fmt_macros, rustc_fs_util, rustc-serialize, quick-error, rustc_platform_intrinsics, crossbeam... stack during panic: #0 [check_impl_item_well_formed] processing `core` #1 [mir_built] processing `main` #2 [borrowck] processing `main` end of query stack error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.31.0-dev running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: Could not compile `rustc`. ```

The symptom is that it ICEs at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/4e88b7363b7858960ccfd87326ece9d00bf4d973/src/librustc_typeck/check/wfcheck.rs#L172 My `config.toml`: ``` [llvm] assertions = true ninja = true [build] submodules = false [rust] debug-assertions = true debuginfo-lines = true incremental = true test-miri = true deny-warnings = false ``` I am invoking `./x.py build src/rustc`. However, this only sometimes happens, and only after working quite a bit with incremental enabled and without cleaning. @oli-obk tried to interpret that backtrace, and said > according to the stacktrace it's a call to Instance::resolve: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/4e88b7363b7858960ccfd87326ece9d00bf4d973/src/librustc_mir/monomorphize/collector.rs#L1073 > > for the start lang item !?
